recommendations.description: Virtual Machine has been deallocated for long with disks still incurring costs
Unattached disks (without owner VM) incur in unnecessary costs
Application Gateways without a backend pool incur in unnecessary costs
Standard Load Balancers with rules defined and without a backend pool incur in unnecessary costs
Availability Sets should have a fault domain count of 3 or equal or greater than half of the Virtual Machines count
Availability Sets should have an update domain count equal or greater than half of the Virtual Machines count
Virtual Machines in unmanaged Availability Sets should not share the same Storage Account
Virtual Machines with unmanaged disks should not share the same Storage Account
Virtual Machines should be placed in an Availability Set together with other instances with the same role
Virtual Machines should not be the only instance in an Availability Set
Each Virtual Machine should have its unmanaged disks stored in a single Storage Account for higher availability and manageability
Virtual Machines should use Managed Disks for higher availability and manageability
Azure AD application with credentials expiration not set or too far in time
Azure AD application with credentials expired or about to expire
Load Balancers without a backend pool are useless
